Title: Series: Croquis pour l'amusement des enfants
Description: Plate 6: seven sketches showing, from left to right and top to bottom, the insurents of Cairo surrending to Bonaparte on 22 October 1798; soldiers armed with spears; a hooded penitent kneeling before a skull and a crucifix; a middle-class man standing with his hands in his pockets; a group of street-musicians; a nanny sitting on a chair with a baby in her lap and a child by her side looking at a pan on a small stove; a soldier carrying his saddle on his back and walking to the left. 1828 Lithograph
Bibliographic references: Giacomelli / Raffet, son oeuvre lithographique et ses eaux-fortes, suivi de la bibliographie complète illustrés de vignettes d'après ses dessins (302)
Associated names: Representation of: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated events: Associated Event: French Campaign in Egypt and Syria 1798-1801
